    Marc Schröder, Sathish, ingmar

      • startup

        public void startup()
             throws Exception
        Description copied from interface: MaryModule
        Allow the module to start up, performing whatever is necessary to become operational. After successful completion, getState() should return MODULE_RUNNING.
        Specified by:

        Overrides:

      • process

        public MaryData process(MaryData d)
                 throws Exception
        Description copied from class: InternalModule
        Perform this module's processing on abstract "MaryData" input d. Subclasses need to make sure that the process() method is thread-safe, because in server-mode, it will be called from different threads at the same time. A sensible way to do this seems to be not to use any global or static variables, or to use them read-only.

        Specified by:
        process in interface MaryModule
        Overrides:
        process in class InternalModule
        Parameters:
        d - d
        Returns:
        A MaryData object of type outputType() encapsulating the processing result.

        This method just returns its input. Subclasses should override this.

        Throws:
        Exception - Exception

      • phonemise

        public String phonemise(String text,
                        String pos,
                        StringBuilder g2pMethod)
        Phonemise the word text. This starts with a simple lexicon lookup, followed by some heuristics, and finally applies letter-to-sound rules if nothing else was successful.
        Parameters:
        text - the textual (graphemic) form of a word.
        pos - the part-of-speech of the word
        g2pMethod - This is an awkward way to return a second String parameter via a StringBuilder. If a phonemisation of the text is found, this parameter will be filled with the method of phonemisation ("lexicon", ... "rules").
        Returns:
        a phonemisation of the text if one can be generated, or null if no phonemisation method was successful.

      • lexiconLookup

        public String lexiconLookup(String text,
                            String pos)
        Look a given text up in the (standard) lexicon. part-of-speech is used in case of ambiguity.
        Parameters:
        text - text
        pos - pos
        Returns:
        null if text == null or text.length is 0, null if entries.length is 0, entries[0] otherwise

      • userdictLookup

        public String userdictLookup(String text,
                             String pos)
        look a given text up in the userdict. part-of-speech is used in case of ambiguity.
        Parameters:
        text - text
        pos - pos
        Returns:
        null if userdict is null or text is null or text.length is 0, null if entries is null, transcr otherwise

      • readLexicon

        protected Map<String,List<String>> readLexicon(String lexiconFilename)
                                        throws IOException
        Read a lexicon. Lines must have the format graphemestring | phonestring | optional-parts-of-speech The pos-item is optional. Different pos's belonging to one grapheme chain may be separated by whitespace
        Parameters:
        lexiconFilename - lexiconFilename
        Returns:
        fLexicon
        Throws:
        IOException - IOException

      • setPh

        protected void setPh(Element t,
                     String ph)

      • setPunctuationPosRegex

        protected void setPunctuationPosRegex()
        Compile a regex pattern used to determine whether tokens are processed as punctuation or not, based on whether their pos attribute matches the pattern.

      • isPosPunctuation

        public boolean isPosPunctuation(String pos)
        Based on the regex compiled in setPunctuationPosRegex(), determine whether a given POS string is classified as punctuation
        Parameters:
        pos - the POS tag
        Returns:
        true if the POS tag matches the regex pattern; false otherwise
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if the regex pattern is null (because it hasn't been set during module startup)

      • maybePronounceable

        public boolean maybePronounceable(String text,
                                  String pos)
        Determine whether token should be pronounceable, based on text and POS tag.
        Parameters:
        text - the text of the token
        pos - the POS tag of the token
        Returns:
        false if the text is empty, or if it contains no word characters and the POS tag indicates punctuation; true otherwise
